snippet: Mark V. Hurd was fired by the board at Hewlett-Packard, but the veracity of a racy lawsuit raises some questions about his ouster at a time when the company was thriving.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column examines newly released June 2010 letter to Mark V Hurd which led to his downfall as Hewlett-Packard chief executive; suggests that sexual harassment allegations should not have led to his dismissal and that the primary people hurt by situation are stockholders who must pay for litigation as a result of accusations.
lead_paragraph: Mark V. Hurd was fired by the board at Hewlett-Packard, but the veracity of a racy lawsuit raises some questions about his ouster at a time when the company was thriving.
